prose.s:
In regnal year eighteen, in the sixth month, on day of the month five, the novice Kalyāṇarakṣite was going to the army.
śak-ok kṣuṃntsa ṣkaśce meṃne piś meñantse ne nawāke kalyānarakṣite retke yey
From the distance, he saw this preṣṭi . laukameṃ ce preṣti lyāka
He went to observe it. palkasi śka masa

translation.line: 十八年六月五日，少年僧 Kalyanarak$ite（过去曾经）参军。他从远方看（军队）这次开拔。他，为了观看而出来。

comments.comment: : [c]e[tk]eye[rś]

preṣṭi is obscure, but likely a term denoting the location in which the inscription is written (Ishek-Grottoes). In Zhao and Rong, it is connected to a non-existent Sanskrit word preṣṭi that is supposed to be derived from Sanskrit preṣ- "send". The editors there also have to assume an otherwise unattested meaning for the imperfect as "was once in the past" - i.e. "went to the army once in the past".

prose.s:
Fourth month, on the full-moon day, Kereptañ-akau gave food.
śtarce päletne kereptañakau śwāle wasa
Milk, 6 kunti, malwer kuntinta 6
traiwo was spent: 4 kunti. traiwo laś kuntinta 4 |
On the first day of the month, the king of Kucha gave food. ñweṃne kUśiñe walo śwāle wasa
Milk was spent: 6 kunti. malwer laś kuntinta 6
traiwo: 2 kunti. traiwo kuntinta 2

On the fourth month, on day twenty four, Rasne invited (the monks to eat).
śtarce ikäṃ-śtwerne rasne kāka
For this reason, the elder Rawaṃske brought oil: teṃntse pely(k)iṃ moko rawaṃśke ṣalywe kamāte
3 mutkāntse. mutkāntseṃ 3

translation.line: 四月十五日，羯猎颠 Akau 给了食物。鲜奶（支出了）6 kunti。 酸奶支出了 4 kunti。 ｜ 三十日， 龟兹王给了食物。 鲜奶支出了 6 kunti。酸奶（支出了） [2] kunti。
四月廿四日，Rasne 招待（僧众）。 因为这个缘故，首领 Rawaśke 拿了奶油：3 mutkāntse*

translation.line: 五月三日，请（僧）的马众拿了奶油：3 mutkantse*。（这是）总管僧侣 Indrαsene 命令了（的）。 | 十七日，请 （僧）的马众拿了鲜奶：2 kunti; 拿了奶油：1 mutkāntse*。总管僧首领（？）看到了。
五月四日，因为 Omorkäñe 马众的缘故， Ākwāne 拿了奶油： 2 mutkāntse*。Aryasome 看到了。五月九日，请（僧）的吗众拿了鲜奶：1 kunti。奶油：半 mutkāntse*。•

translation.line: 依照二十一日以的降（人？）数，也要配向 Mutrune* 居民（？）的口粮
二十一日，口粮（？）支出了 3 斗。晦日支出了 2 斗。
二十二（日），口粮（？）支出了 2 斗。
二十三日支出了 3 斗。
二十四日支出了 1（？）斗。
二十五日 ［支出 ］了 3 斗。
二十六日支出了 3 斗。
二十七日支出了 3 斗。
二十八日支出了 2 斗。
二十九日［支出］了 1（？）斗。
......：9 斗。三月，众人受用了（粮食〉。作当 sāle 的......消耗是：...... 。
......：1 斗。同日 ，Śśiṅke 拿了婆罗遮（?) klese-sāle......。
......斗。月四日，为了净人们的 sāle，送去 Teṅke......。
月七（日），首领 Budhaciwe（拿了？）送去 Teṅke（的 klese？）......。
三月十二日，Candradewe 外出（？或者：去了婆罗遮？），......klese......。
三月十七日 ，...... Sematate...... Saṅkaseñi......。
同日，我给了 sāle 供作食用：2 斗。
同日，Semasene 前往城镇。 他拿了 klese-sāle ......。

prose.s:
In the Apratitulya-tune:
|| apratitulyeṃne ||
The remains of the King of Kucha Suvarṇadeve... here... kUśiññepi lānte ; svarṇade(vi) (tne) ; śari(r)

There arose to him a manner of thinking:
keś tättālñe tsäṅkāne (:)

Without a break, then, the beings born in these places... (endure) sufferings. ot s(nai) laut(e) toṃ ; ykentane wnolmi ; tetemoṣ
, läklenta :
I recieved... destroying enmity and pleasure in this teaching... ñiś no kälpāw(a) ; ś(onai) (yś)el(m)e nta ; näksemane , śāsaṃne ce l·

Thereupon, I roused my mind:
tu yparwe=rsamai ; palsko
May I be able to do some deed in this monastery, in (my) roots (?)... (cä)mpim kca ; ce saṅkrāmne , witsakanne ; wäntre yā(mtsi)

There were more than ten thousand Pratyekabuddhas here.
tman=auṣap ; pratyaikabuddhi ; takār tane ,
In this very place, in the monastary of caves, they came to extinction. tnek kessante ; gunmacce s(aṅkā),r(āmne)

... this monastery... Bhadrakāme the Arhant was refuge here.
, ṅkrām ce : bhadrakāme s(ai)m ; arhānte ṣai tne ;
His students, thousands in total, fulfilled... cwī aklaṣlyi , yaltse solme ; kyā(nare)

... -śānte, Dharmapāle, Saṅghaiśe...
śānte ; dharmapāle , saṅghaiśe :
Also to them were many students, Bodhisattvas... ceṃts rano māka ; takār aklaṣlyi ; bodhisa(tvi)

His lack to go to speek in the mountain cave is visible (?)...
; ṣleṣṣe guṃṇne wentsi , yatsi ; t(a)k(a) meṅki , lkātärne :
Thus, I roused my mind... tūsa palsko , e(r)s(a)m(ai) ñ(iś)

... terrible... produces... in hell, among animals and pretas, divine and human...
mpelya : tanmäṣṣäṃ nraine ; lw(ā)s(a) pr(e)tenne ; ñäkcye śām(ñ)e

The thought arose to me to... karpāräṣṣai...
ñī tsaṅka ; palsko ce ykene ; karpāräṣṣai

translation.line: || 调寄 Apratitulye || 为龟兹王苏伐[叠]......舍利
对他（或者：它）产生了想法。而[不久]众生出生在这些地方
......苦恼......不过，一面克服（恶事）和性欲，我在这个教训里得到了......（苦恼）
然后我产生了（这样的）想法，希望我在这座寺院的根（基？）里（做）......事
......一万名以上的辟支佛在这里。他们在这座有石窟的（寺院里）得到了寂灭。
在这座寺院里......Bhadrakāme......依止处......阿罗汉在这里。他的一千名佛子们都（实现了）
......?-śānte、Dharmapāle、Saṅghaiśe。他们也有很多弟子们、菩萨们
......在山窟里说话、行徒，见到他（自己）的缺陷（？）......
这座寺院极好......很宏大。因此，我产生了（这样的）想法
......可怕......他让（众生）出生在地狱、在畜生（道）、在饿鬼（道）、（在）天（界）、（在）人（世）
于是我产生了（这样的）想法。在这座山区（？）......

line.tr: || In the tune of Apratitulye || By (?) the Kuchean king Suvarṇadeva here (?), the remains […]
To him the thought arose. Then […] the creatures were born in these places […]
[…] sufferings. 1. But I obtained […] suffering (?) in destroying enmity and (sexual) pleasure in this teaching […]
Thereupon, I evoked a thought (as follows). I might do […] thing at the roots (= at the foot) of this monastery. […]
[…] here existed more than ten thousand Pratyekabuddhas. They came to extinction here in the monastery provided with caves. […]
[…] this monastery […] Bhadrakāme, refuge, an arhat was here. All his thousand pupils fulfilled […]
[…] -śānte, Dharmapāle, Saṅghaiśe […] 3. To them there were many Bodhisattvas as (their) pupils […]
the lack is still seen to him to go to speak (= to preach a sermon) in the cave of a mountain. […]
[…] excellent (is) this huge monastery. Thereby I evoked the thought (as follows). […]
[…] terrible […] it makes (creatures?) born in animals and Pretas in a hell, in divine and human worlds […]
[…] the thought arose to me (as follows). In this place at a declivity of a mountain […]

comments.comment: Only recto; two joint pieces (upper one with lines 1–8, lower one with lines 9–11) found in June 1990 in the central-pillar Cave no. 58 datable to the 7th century; see .

You invited the Buddha Śikhī (to eat).
nano śikhiṃ pañäk(t)e śwātsi kakātai
You established a monastery. saṅkrām yamaṣa(t)ai
You were king. walo ṣait ||

translation.line: 又，你请尸弃佛用餐。你建立僧伽蓝。你是王者。||

recto.line: [4] kṣuṃ [n]tsa [yu] [khwā] l· nti pā¯ ¯Ś pa lne [ṣa] mā ne[ṃ] dha rma ka r[MA] ña ṣā [re]

transcription.prose: 4 kṣuṃntsa yukhwā l(ā)nti pāś p«iku»lne ṣamāneṃ dharmakarmä ñaṣāre

translation.line: Yśuhkwā 王 34（？）年，兔年，他们要求僧侣们行善了。

comments.comment: A hapax legomenon. It's not exactly clear what dharmakarman entails.
sic! This form is very peculiar. The ‹kh› isn't a single akṣara, but a ligature of ‹k› and ‹h›. We would expect yśu hkwā.
sic! Probably a mistake for pā¯ ¯Ṣ
Probably a mistake for pi ku lne

According to the editors, this inscription can be precisely dated. The barely legible 4 in the beginning can only be part of 34, since we know that Yśuhkwā ascended the throne in the year of the horse, thus making 34 the only possible date for the year of the rabbit that has a '4' at the end of it. Thus this inscription was written in 811, making it the latest of all dated inscriptions.

comments.comment: From Sanskrit Buddhi-candra, even though one would expect Putticandre. It couldn't be a form in -ścandra like Hariścandra since those were only productive in the early Vedas.

recto.line: [śa] kṣu kṣu nt[s]a

comments.comment: for śak-ṣukt.

recto.line: wa [ku] [ln]· [śa] [kṣ]· ntsa t· n· [a] [pu]

translation.line: 猪（？）年，十一年，［空白范围约 2 个字符宽］在此......[磨损范围约 4 个字符宽]......

comments.comment: The editors argue that (pi) is to be restituted between wa and [ku], and that we should read (su)wa (pi)[kuln](e). The only king whose 11th year on the throne corresponded to the year of the pig was Kṣemārcune. Thus this inscription can be dated to 771.

comments.comment: Could be Indradewe, cf. Kg-012-YD-N-01. Sadly, the precise date of this king's rule is not known.

The way the date is written here is rather strange. One would expect the name of the king to be written before lānte, not after. Also, one kṣutsa is superfluous here. For a similar example,, see Kz-145-ZS-R-14.

translation.strophe: ああ、彼は(人々が？）望みを放棄するのを見るために、この場所を渡った。善人達によって、国を安寧に導くものも豊かになった。もし病・貧困・死を恐れた者達があらゆる再生への不安は恐ろしい彼らはここに到達する。
諸々の煩悩による恐ろしい多くの敵達に対して恐れを抱く者は、高く、離れて、(?)幸福な悪く、大きい果報として変えるだろう。彼は、諸々の功徳をろう。
彼は房・舎・石窟径行処によって満足させ、考えるだろう。如何にすれば確実に善人達は解脱へと赴く努力するために
また必ず、悪く、恐ろしい時が訪れるだろう。功徳の滅ぼす（或いは「取り除く」）。功徳の恐怖へと善人達・功徳・悪彼等の（或い「人々の」？は）悪事・悪徳を、この時が増幅する。これがその法則である。
そのようにない。習慣から離れることもしこの時悪徳或いは、もし彼等が悪事を行えば（これらの）場所は残り続けるだろう功徳の彼らが諸々の悪事に赴く時
これらの恐ろしい、煩悩よりなるものに対して避難所とすべきである。あたかもの如くである。三昧(?)は知見より諸々の毒を取り除くためであり、敵が存在しない道である。或いは、また諸々の煩悩
のは滅ぼす（或いは「取り除く」）。この(?)思推の像達の(?)蜚語(?)により、また憎しみ僧院において

s.tr: Whoever leaves the home for homelessness, having given up all of his relatives together with desire in word and mind, tamed by the fear of the disappearance of things, he left home by the strength of a fortified (?) wish.
s.s: kUse nai ksa ṅke , onolme ; os(tameṃ) läc«†a» , snai ostäśc :
rek(i) (a)räñc,ne po ṣ ṣäñ ; śamna rerinormeṃ , ślek ñasa :

s.tr: Being equipped with monkhood [and] a repentant mind, you own mind... with honor, be you helpful for me in the fulfilment of my wish!

s.tr: If me... to stand by the order of the teacher... and you are long not conducting yourself in the three terrible behaviors (?) , then time... all Kleśas with the coming together with the good... grow... of yourself (?).

Those who are weary from saṃsāra can find an and here. kUse saṃtsārsa , lalaloṣ ; täne ake , kälalle :

translation.strophe: 願いに従って、言葉と心において、全ての親族を捨て去り、住著のない状態を目指して出家した者は、諸物が滅びる恐怖に御せられ、溝のような[=強い]願望の力によって家を離れて。
沙門の身分と後悔のない心を構えた者は、自尊心を以ってする者であり、自らの思いを。願望が実現する際には、あなたは私の協力者となれ。生涯、あなたが発せられた決心を忘れないように。
もし師の命令において私が留まる事三有支(?)の長きにわたり、あなたは恐ろしい存在のままに留まる事はないだろう。そして、時は(?)一切の苦悩と善行と共にある事で、あなたは自らの（或いは「願いの」）を増やさねばならない。
彼らの（或いは「それらの」）煽動によって、衆生感覚器官には。あなたは、彼らの徳行(?)を知らねばならない。我々は全て次の生に赴く。我々の生に（衆生を）導く者は、人々の日難所として生まれる。怒りや執着などを取り除くために。
この釈迦族の者は以前この人を三つ(?)。これはそれぞれ（その）場所へ通ずるものであり、我々もあなたに（それを）与える(?)。種々の苦脳や賞賛の(?)彼等は説く。輪廻の中で努力する者達、（その者達に対しては）この世において終わりがもたらされ得る。

comments.comment: The correction leläñaṣ by the editors can be rejected. Rather, we're probably dealing with laläñ(e)ṣe here. The wall in the photographs provided by the editors is damaged at this part. Thus, it is difficult to make out what it says. However, from a purely grammatical point of view, laläñeṣe is better than the participle, which would mean "the resolve that has left" instead of "the resolve of leaving".
Reading spertteṃ for ·[ṣ] (·)te[ṃ] together with the editors.
wälkatär is a hapax. Maybe it is related to walke "for a long time". Thus, I have translated it as "remain". Of course, this is tentative.

pada.s:
Whoever is noble speaks (of?) pretexts of the village (= vulgar pretexts?).
kU«se» tsa nai (ṅ)kai klyomoṣi kUṣaiṣṣeñya ṣewi w(e)ske(ṃ) :
"Why (?) do this arrogance [and] bliss of rest come to the good? ka se krentats śarwarññe sÄkwa añuṣṣe känmāskeṃ :
Zeal to destroy this power of the Kleśas is proper." ce kka wärkṣäl kca kleśanmats speltke nautsi ayato :
This they say to the good with intoxicating nitsas. mā(la)tsana krentätso te ra weskeṃ śle nitsas :

āpaṣṣetse mourns because of the suffering of undergoing.
āpaṣṣetse kUwäsnatär wär(pa)lyñeṣṣe läklesa :
Undergoing mourns through the suffering of lamenting. wärpaläññe kUwäsnatär trä(ṅkälyñe) (läkle)sā
Lamenting mourns because of the suffering of invitation. träṅkälyñe kUw(ä)snatär kakalyñeṣṣe (lä)klesā :
... zeal... is not... skeyye p· mā nesäṃ
... mourns... sos l*e kUwäsnatär :

Youth mourns because of the suffering of old age.
ñuwetsäñe kUwäsnatär ktsaitsäññeṣṣe lä(kl)esa :
Old age (mourns) because of the suffering of depressing illnesses. ktsaitsäñe amiśkeṃ teka(nma)ṣe läklesa :
Capable ones mourn because of the suffering of weakening. yāta(lyñecci) kwäsnantär spärkalyñeṣṣe läklesa :
Weakening mourns because of the suffering of death. swärkaññe kUw(ä)sn(a)tär srukalyñeṣṣe läklesa :

The eight sufferings (just mentioned) each mourn because of the pain of separation from you.
okt läklenta waiptayär täñ (ts)r(e)lñ(e) lä(k)l(esa/ā) kUwäsnatär :
Eight... tpāne Kleśas... mourn through... (o)kt tpāne (ṣ)pä kl(e)ś(anma) lyñe(s)ā (kUwäsnatä)r
... mourns... deeds... r kUwäsnatär yamornta
... good... law without law... snai pelecce (pe)laikne ··e kreñc ·e ·eṃ :

translation.strophe: 聖者たる者達が、村人の弁明を述べる。善人達には、この自尊心と寂静による幸福が訪れる。（彼等）、この諸々の苦悩による力を滅ぼす勢力（を行う）に相応しい。人を溺れさせる諸々の苦悩(?)は、善人達にを以って、また以下のように述べる。
水生の生き物は、捕まえられる苦しみを悲しむ。捕まえられるものは、[自らの死を]嘆かれる苦しみを悲しむ。[自らの死]嘆かれるものは、[死の神に]呼ばれる苦しみを悲しむ。勢力はない。は悲しむ(3sg.)。
若者は、老いる苦しみを嘆く。老いた者は、諸々の病の絶望的な苦しみを(嘆く）。権力や能力を有する者達は、(権力や能力が）消え去る事を悲しむ。ちからのない者は、死の苦しみを悲しむ。
彼は、八苦及びあなたと離れて別れる苦しみを悲しむ。彼は、八苦を彼に伝えた。を悲しむ(3sg.)。悲しむ(3sg.)。諸行法に敵わない法善人達は。

comments.comment: This document is difficult to interpret. There are a lot of hapax legomena. In verses 2-4, there appear to be personification of different qualities ("old age" instead of "old people", "weakening" instead of "people getting weaker"). Both the broad meaning of the inscription and the meaning of single phrases is difficult to grasp.
ka is probably kā "why".
Assuming kᵤwäsnatär is a mistake for kᵤwäsnantär.

comments.comment: The most probable explanation for this form is that the vowel diacritics were added after the main body of the akṣaras. The person who wrote the inscription then did not put the diacritics in the right place. Thus we have tene śam instead of tane śem.

prose.s:
In the Pañcama-tune:
pañcamn(e) :

pada.s: Here, someone who is firm and desirous, is not reliable and (in truth) not firm (at all). (p)r(a)kr(e) t(a)n(e) (e)ṅkältse empäkwate ma prakre :
If he wants desire, there is suffering of longing. ñäskemane eṅkäl kwri ritalyñeṣe läkle ste :
After having received it, there is suffering of guarding. kälpormeno tw-ompostäṃ paṣalyñeṣe läkle ste :
Thus, it is the duty of the good one to not feel desire again. tusa mā=ykne kreñcepi eṅkäl yamttsi wacene:

translation.line: （调寄）Pañcama:
translation.strophe: 世间强者受执缚, （实则）浮沉难自固。 倘使追逐（心）所爱, 企求渴望斯为苦。:（倘使）得偿（心所欲）, 保持守护斯为苦。: 是以贤者离贪染 ，不（以所念之）为务。 ： 1

translation.line: 在这（个世界上）, 坚定的（人）为贪爱所着,（其实）不可靠也不坚定。: 如果（这样的人）追求所爱,（他便）有渴望的苦。:（如果他）得到之后, （他便）有保护的苦。 : 所以对善人来说,（世间的爱）不是义务，他把爱欲放在次要的（位置）。: 1

comments.comment: According to the editors mā aikne.
According to the editors, prakre is skr. dṛḍha- 'firm, strong' and eṅkäl is skr. (saṃ)rāga- 'greed, desire'.

The editors translate this as (The desire of the world) is not the duty of the good one. He considers love as secondary. However, in this case, it would be difficult to say what the infinitive yāmttsi depends on.

recto.line: 6 kṣu ntsa tri cce [c]o cce ne śta rcye ñu ne tai tsyā ku neṃ mo lmi śi
nau ṣweṃ tsa mai we¯ ¯ñ PA kā ñce e [ṣ]i [rṣā] [nä] yke ne si mtsa mai ta re tu ntse [ṣo] tr[i] pai yka re |

prose.s:
In regnal year 6, third month, in the cocce day , fourth month, on day nine, young päkāñ(c) came to this... place along the border (?), with general Molmiśi at the fore.
6 kṣuntsa tricce coccene śtarcye ñune taitsyāṃkuneṃ molmiśi
nauṣweṃtsa maiweñ päkāñ ce eṣi rṣānä ykene simtsa maitare
They painted a sign thereof. tuntse ṣotri paiykare |

translation.line: 6 年，周（朝）的三月，四月九日，以大将军莫苾
为首的，冠有白（*Päk）［姓］的一群年轻人来到这个......地界 ，写其记。

comments.comment: : co cce teṃ
: Eti[laṣ]ā[t]o

The editors believe that coccene is an adjective derivation in -tstse of Chinese 周 (zhou), denoting here the interregnum of Wu Zetian. However, from the context alone, we would much rather expect coccene to denote some kind of (holi)day, since it follows directly after the month. If coccene truly denoted a dynasty, we would expect it to be at the very beginning of the line, before kṣuntsa. For another example of an adjective in -tstse denoting a holiday, see parāce.

The editors identify Molmiśi with 莫苾 (mòbì, EMC *mak-bjit, LMC *mak-pɦjit) known from Chinese documents. This stretches the limits of phonetic plausibility. How would the cluster -kbj- turn into -lm-, and final -t into -śi?

The editors read päkāñ(c), arguing that the c has been dropped because of the following ceṃ. They connect it to Chinese 白 (bái, *baek), a name often given to Tocharians in Chinese documents, glossing it as "provided with (the surname) päk". However, I believe it is much more likely that the form is to be read as päkāñ, and that it is Tocharian and not a loan word. Maybe there is some connection to Greek πέπων, a word meaning "ripe" that can also be used as a term of endearment when addressing a person. From a morphophonological point of view, it would fit very well.
There is a Chinese character below this word that the editors read as 督 ("supervise" or "governor").

translation.line: In the year nine, in the 3rd month, on the 17th day, under the rule of the Great Kuchean King Salare*. At this moment, (being present at ...?),
a Prince Niyire*'s mañiye called Massone (and) his brother called [P]urnāśä, these two (are namely) us. Here (are) [his(?)] saṃgha's
mañiye called Puṣpakerti (and) his wife called Netla. • (Here) is the son of those two called Eśkulke.
[This] Eśkulke, we two bought from (his) father (and) mother in a bad, famine period. The Moko
monk agreed. • [Here] (and) now, this Eśkulke is not happy near by us (i.e. by our side). For this reason, we sell this
Eśkulke. (Here) are a [monk] of Yurpāṣka (with the title) Abhidharmike called Buddhavräddhi,
an Araññe called Dharmaśarme, an Araññe called Aryavräddhi, (and) their brother called Samyosä.
We sell him to them: 105000 Kuchean coins in cash(?). Without yakau, without (any)thing left to be paid. ...
shall be (his/its) [own](?). Forever in the future, he should not be claimed by anyone else nor should be enquired about (by anyone else). [Here] (are): Dharmattrāte the Saṅka-
-dhare • Dharmaruci the Araññe • Dharmasene the Araññe • Dharmarakṣite the Araññe •
Buddhabhadre the Agamadhare (and) the Praskāre • Dharmanāre the Agamadhare (and) the Praskāre • Nokarti, the brother of the Ṣletaś • Arśol
the Orśa • Arcu[t]a the King's kalyä • Eñcike, the son of the Oko_u* of Preyole* • Arosä the King's kārṣṣe •
At this moment, ... [Ā]ryakame (or: [A]ryakame) ... Koramakke. The kañe of himself/oneself/itself ... of Massone ...
九年三月十七（日），在龟兹大王 Salare* 的统治期间。此时，（在......处）
Niyiri* 王子的一名奴仆名唤 Massone，其兄弟名唤 Purnāśä，这（便是）我等二人。（在这里面还有）他的僧伽的
一名唤作 Puṣpakerti 的奴仆，其妻名唤Netla。现在这里有（夫妻）俩的儿子名唤 Eśkulke。
这名 Eśkulke （乃）我等二人在凶恶饥馑之时，从（他的）双亲边买过来的。
（当时）已经获得担任首领（Moko）的沙门的允许。此时此刻，这名 Eśkulke 在我俩身边不幸福。因此我俩卖出
这名 Eśkulke。现在这里有耶婆瑟鸡的习论沙门，名唤 Buddhavräddhi；
一位林栖者，名唤 Aryavräddhi；（以及）他们的兄弟，名为 Samyosä。
我俩将他卖给以上（？）诸人：现款15000龟兹钱。

comments.comment: Note the depalatalized menne for meñne.
